instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.Q7706: What is Q7706? Q7706 takes PPBUS_G3H's main 12.6v and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q7706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R7788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q7706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting ? dead cpu
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBA

Liquid spill
Corrosion around <CHIP>U7870</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C7870</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C7871</CAPACITOR>

No fan spin
Replaced a terrible looking <CAPACITOR>C7870</CAPACITOR>---> fan spin
Orange light on charger

CPU VCORE: 1.8V
No backlight
No image
No chime
Fan is spinning
All G3H power rails are good

USB Mouse does not light up
USB SATA drive adapter spins up an old 2.5"HDD

I'm thinking this board is not even starting
Where to start?

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>: 5.15V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>: 5.14V

<TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR>
4: 8.58V
3: 8.34V
2,5,6: 0 V

Thats with the LCD connected and without

On <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR>: I thought since voltage on 4 > 3 <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR> should be open

In any case without real USB activity, the board is not turning on and thats the issue correct?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting ? dead cpu
threads.message:
"I thought since voltage on 4 > 3 <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR> should be open"
Do you think Vgs=-0.24V is sufficient???
However, no reason to check backlight, if no image, nor USB activity detected.

Post <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PLT_RST_BUF_L</SIGNAL>.
Check all SPI Bus Series termination resistors (page 46) and their traces.
Also clean J6100; remove it, if you do not use Medusa programmer.
Be sure to get all voltages from pages 57/58.

Try known good BIOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting ? dead cpu
threads.message:
OK that worked.

<RESISTOR>R6119</RESISTOR> measured 200K
Changed it out and boom!
USB now works
Machine boots!

Can you tell me why you went to the SPI termination resistors?

THANKS!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting ? dead cpu
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R6119</RESISTOR> is placed between PCH and BIOS chip...
